text: Gryfice (; Kashubian: Grëfice), formerly known as Greifenberg,". 1880. is a town in Pomerania, north-western Poland with 16,632 people (2008). It is the capital of Gryfice County in West Pomeranian Voivodeship (since 1999), previously in Szczecin Voivodeship (1975–1998). == Twin towns — Sister cities == Gryfice is twinned with: * Güstrow * Meldorf * Gryfów Śląski ==References== == Other websites == * Official website Category:Towns in West Pomeranian Voivodeship
title: Gryfice
